passage_text: 4 years ago. You can not take food into the park. Six Flags will allow you to leave and re-enter the park and get your hand stamped.. ChaCha! 5 years ago. No. Food, beverages or coolers may not be brought into the park at Six Flags Great Adventure in New Jersey.

:: Food. This is a tricky one because food is so expensive at parks. Six Flags does not allow you to bring in your own food. However, they will stamp your hand at the gate so you can leave and come back.

Pack a picnic lunch if your budget is extremely tight. Outside food or drinks are not allowed inside the park, but you can store food in a cooler in your car. If you’re visiting Six Flags Over Texas, you can eat your meal in the picnic area outside the park gates. Other parks don’t have designated picnic areas, so you will need to eat lunch at your vehicle.

Last year at Six Flags (Maryland) security checked our purses and took our snack bars and water bottles and threw them in the trash. Unfortunately, outside food and drink are not allowed in Six Flags. You have to eat outside the park if you bring your own food.

Also take river shoes (water shoes) with you. The pathways between rides and pools can get very hot. Six Flags doesn’t allow you to take a cooler inside, so you’ll have buy all your food and drinks inside. The food and drinks are fairly pricey. To save a little, we make sure we eat something before arriving at the park.

Best Answer: They won't let you bring outside food into the park. You can store it in a locker outside the park, or leave it in the car. The only thing you are allowed to take into the park as far as food and beverages go is infant formula and bottled water.
This Site Might Help You. RE: can i bring food to six flags?? my family and some friends are going this Friday and the food there is mega expensive can't we at least bring water or candy ........
